00020 /**
00021  * @file   ErrHandler.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Mon Jun 26 10:13:11 2006
00024  * 
00025  * @brief Interface for doing something with the errors generated by
00026  * Err::errAbort().
00027  */
00028 
00029 #ifndef ERRHANDLER_H
00030 #define ERRHANDLER_H
00031 
00032 #include <cstring>
00033 #include <string>
00034 //
00035 
00036 /**
00037  * Abstract base class (aka interface) for handling errors that come from
00038  * Err::errAbort(). Write a class inheriting from ErrHandler and push it 
00039  * onto the handler stack via Err::pushErrHandler(). 
00040  */
00041 class ErrHandler {
00042 
00043 public:
00044   /** Virtual destructor for a virtual class. */
00045   virtual ~ErrHandler() {}
00046 
00047   /** Prototype for the function */
00048   virtual void handleError(const std::string &msg) = 0;
00049 
00050   /** Will this error handler be throwing exceptions? */
00051   virtual bool getThrows() { return false; }
00052 
00053   /** Will this error handler be throwing exceptions? */
00054   virtual void setThrows(bool doThrow) {}
00055 
00056   /** Will this error handler set the value returned when 
00057     * exiting on errors
00058     */
00059 
00060   virtual void setExitOnError(bool val) {}
00061   /** The value to return if the error handler returns
00062     * specifies the value
00063         */
00064   virtual void setExitOnErrorValue(int val) {}
00065 
00066 };
00067 
00068 
00069 #endif /* ERRHANDLER_H */
